title.narrative: Uthållig och förnybar energi för alla

description.narrative: Denna insats, ledd av franska NGOn GERES, tillhandahåller förnybar el för småskaligt företagande på landsbygden, i områden som inte täcks av det statliga elnätet. GERES har begärt stöd om 66,3 MSEK för att skala upp den modell de redan installerat i tre byar till 5 nya och samtidigt förbereda för en storskalig uppskalning. Lokala myndigheter bidrar med mark. En privat operatör kommer att sköta underhåll och fakturering. Huvudsyftet med insatsen är att förbättra tillgången på förnybar energi i regionerna Sikasso, Ségou och Kayes genom att producera förnybar produktiv (som skapar arbetstillfällen och inkomst) energi och att därigenom bidra till ekonomisk och social utveckling samt stabilitet på landsbygden in Mali. Insatsen har tre huvudsakliga delsyften: 1) Förbättrad kapacitet att producera förnybar energi för ekonomisk utveckling baserat på lokalbefolkningens behov. 2) Stärka kapacitet lokalt för , förbättrad resiliens, stärkt social inkludering och förbättrade levnadsvillkor. 3) Skapa förutsättningar för långsiktig skötsel för gröna ekonomiska zoner med socialt företagande och resursmobilisering. Insatsen bidrar till alla tre huvudprioriteringarna i Mali’s Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC): energi, forestry/land use change och jordbruk (de första två mer än det tredje).

This intervention, led by the French NGO GERES supplies renewable energy for small-scale enterprise in rural areas that are not covered by the national grid. GERES has requested support of 66.3 MSEK to scale up a model they have already installed in three villages to another 5 and at the same time prepare for larger scaling up. Local authorities contribute with land. A private operator will handle maintenance and billing. The main objective is to improve access to renewable energy in the Sikasso, Ségou and Kayes regions by producing renewable productive (generating employment and income) energy, thereby contributing to economic and social development as well as stability in rural Mali. There are three specific objectives: 1) Improve capacity to produce renewable energy and put it to productive use based on needs of local people. 2) Strengthen the capacity of local actors and improve their economic resilience, promote inclusion and improved living conditions. 3) Establish conditions for sustainable management of green business areas with social enterprise and mobilisation of resources for its funding. The intervention is contributing to all three priorities in Mali's Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC): energy, forestry/land use change and agriculture (the first two more than the third).

The Sustainable Energy Access for All project aims to improve access to renewable energies and productive uses of energy in the regions of Sikasso, Ségou and Kayes, contributing to economic and social development as well as territorial stability in rural Mali. Specific objectives include to increase the capacity of renewable energy generation and economic devlopment in these areas as well as to support the local people to take part of this development and increase their economic resilience and their conditions for work and general life. Expected results are: Result 1: Initiatives will be initiated that facilitate access to productive energy uses, taking into account the specific features of each territory and in an inclusive manner. Result 2: Small enterprises and community groups will be backed in order to maximise the economic development impact. Result 3: The establishment of a social entreprise model based on activity zones with electric power supply will be supported. Result 4: Results and lessons learned will be documented, analysed and shared on local, regional and national levels in order to create replicability and implementation in larger scale.

participating-org.narrative: GERES/Groupe Energies Renouvelables, Environnement et Solidarites
GERES/Groupe Energies Renouvelables, Environnement et Solidarites

sector.narrative: Energy generation, renewable sources - multiple technologies

tag.narrative: 7.b - By 2030, expand infrastructure and upgrade technology for supplying modern and sustainable energy services for all in developing countries, in particular least developed countries, small island developing States and landlocked developing countries, in accordance with their respective programmes of support.

7.b - Till 2030 bygga ut infrastrukturen och uppgradera tekniken för att leverera moderna och hållbara energitjänster till alla i utvecklingsländerna, i synnerhet de minst utvecklade länderna och små önationer under utveckling.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
Major achievements and results for 2021.
Result 1
The architectural construction sites for the GBAs in Falo, Dougoulou, Mièna and Kiffosso1.
Four energy infrastructure constructions have been initiated in Falo, Dougoulou, Miena and Kiffosso1.
Implementation of one diagnostic of the governance and management structure of the GBA in Koury and Konséguéla.
A standard management scheme has been defined with identification of roles and responsibilities.
Five water wells drilled.
Eight solar irrigation systems connected to the water wells installed.
Result 2
38 business plans developed and realised at the GBAs in Falo, Dougoulou, Miéna and Kifosso.
38 Very Small Enterprises (VSE) have been installed at the GBAs in Falo, Dougoulou, Miéna and Kifosso.
Recruitment of three entrepreneurial advisor to reinforce the support to the VSEs.
29 individual profession specific trainings for the VSEs in Koury, Diaramana, Moro-Moro, Dougoulou, Miéna and Kifosso.
Two signed conventions and one amendment with local IMFs.
More than 140 000USD mobilised by the IMFs.
Result 3
Pilote component of SHS kits up and running with a prolonged contract with supplier.
Creation of the Social Enterprise in progress. This includes recruitment of General Director, signing contract of technical assistance by the cabinet JURISIF prolonged, signed contract with organisation for support of evaluations.
Result 4
Base-line study realised for the four GBAs in Miena, Falo, Dougoulou, Kiffosso1.
Experience exchange and lessons learned workshop for the constructions of the GBAs.
Meetings with local structures during the selection of the VSEs and development of the management system.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
